text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: Cholera is an infection in the small intestine caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae .

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: The main symptoms are watery diarrhea and vomiting .

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: Transmission occurs primarily by drinking water or eating food that has been contaminated by the feces (waste product) of an infected person, including one with no apparent symptoms.

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: The severity of the diarrhea and vomiting can lead to rapid dehydration and electrolyte imbalance, and death in some cases.

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: The primary treatment is oral rehydration therapy , typically with oral rehydration solution , to replace water and electrolytes.

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: If this is not tolerated or does not provide improvement fast enough, intravenous fluids can also be used.

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: Antibacterial drugs are beneficial in those with severe disease to shorten its duration and severity.

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: Worldwide, it affects 3–5 million people and causes 100,000–130,000 deaths a year .

text_left: how are cholera and typhus transmitted and prevented
text_right: Cholera was one of the earliest infections to be studied by epidemiological methods.

text_right: The Picture of Dorian Gray is the only published novel by Oscar Wilde , appearing as the lead story in Lippincott's Monthly Magazine on 20 June 1890, printed as the July 1890 issue of this magazine.

text_left: how old is sybil vane in the picture of dorian gray
text_right: The magazine's editors feared the story was indecent as submitted, so they censored roughly 500 words, without Wilde's knowledge, before publication.

text_left: how old is sybil vane in the picture of dorian gray
text_right: But even with that, the story was still greeted with outrage by British reviewers, some of whom suggested that Wilde should be prosecuted on moral grounds, leading Wilde to defend the novel aggressively in letters to the British press.

text_left: how old is sybil vane in the picture of dorian gray
text_right: Wilde later revised the story for book publication, making substantial alterations, deleting controversial passages, adding new chapters and including an aphoristic Preface which has since become famous in its own right.
